Education Ph.D., The Graduate Center, CUNY (2017,  Computer Science / Cryptography)M.Phil., The Graduate Center, CUNY (2017,  Computer Science)M.S., City College of New York, CUNY (2017,   Computer Science)M.A., Hunter College, CUNY (2011, Mathematics)B.A., Hunter College, CUNY (2011, Mathematics) Bio Matluba Khodjaeva is an Associate Professor in the Department of Mathematics and Computer Science at John Jay College of Criminal Justice, a member of the Graduate Faculty in the Digital Forensics and Cyber Security program, and a Doctoral Faculty member in Computer Science at the CUNY Graduate Center. She earned her Ph.D. in Computer Science from the CUNY Graduate Center in 2017.Her primary research interests lie in cryptography, with a particular focus on secure outsourcing of computations to the cloud and the design and implementation of efficient, secure cryptographic protocols for computationally constrained devices, such as RFID tags and other embedded systems. Her work bridges theoretical security guarantees with practical, real-world applications, aiming to protect sensitive information in environments where computational resources are limited.In addition to her research, Dr. Khodjaeva is dedicated to teaching and mentoring students at both undergraduate and graduate levels, fostering the next generation of experts in cryptography, cybersecurity, and computer science.
